item.title: Testing asynchronous code
item.description: From time to time developers must write asynchronous code. This can for example be to access a database or make a network call. Writing asynchronous code is getting easier and easier. And Languages and frameworks provide better tools than ever - What a time to be a developer!. There is only one thing, which still remains true for the most cases: Testing asynchronous code in isolation can be really difficult. We will make it look easy for Kotlin with a simple trick.
